packet-switching.translation[0].definiti: a method of sending information stored on a computer, usually across the Internet. Long messages are broken into pieces and put together again when they are received.
packet-switching.translation[1].definiti: a way of sending a large amount of DATA (=information stored on a computer) between computers by dividing it into small pieces which are each sent separately and put together again when they are received
Canadaâ€™s Northern Telecom Ltd. will equip the Czech Republic with data packet-switching equipment for a public network.
